RIL AGM: Mukesh Ambani bullish on Reliance's growth; no word on Jio, Retail IPOsMukesh Ambani was bullish on the conglomerate's growth and said that Reliance was on track to more than double in size before the end of this decade.

Shah Rukh Khan enters Hurun India Rich List with Rs 7,300 crore net worthKnown for his recent hits like 'Jawan' and 'Pathaan', Khan's wealth isn't just from his successful film career but also from his stakes in the IPL team, Kolkata Knight Riders, which have significantly increased in value.
Sensex, Nifty end higher driven by gains in RIL stock The S&P BSE Sensex added 349.05 points to end at 82,134.61, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 99.60 points to close at 25,151.95.

RIL AGM: Reliance retail in top 5 globally in terms of stores The company also ranks among the top ten retailers worldwide in terms of market capitalisation and is in the top twenty for the number of employees.

RIL becomes India's first company to surpass Rs 10 lakh crore in annual revenueThis milestone was announced at the RIL AGM (annual general meeting), making Reliance the first Indian company to reach this landmark.
RIL AGM: Reliance Industries set to discuss 1:1 bonus shares on September 5RIL chairman Mukesh Ambani said that Reliance rewards its shareholders when the conglomerate grows at its AGM.

Paytm shares jump 5% today. Check price targetsPaytm plans to reapply for a payment aggregator (PA) licence, which analysts see as a positive move that may alleviate regulatory concerns.

Hurun India Rich List 2024: Check top 10, youngest billionaire and other details With India's billionaire count rocketing to 334, this year's list showcases an extraordinary leap, marking a sixfold increase since its debut 13 years ago.
Explained: Why IndiGo shares fell 3% in early trade todayAround 6% of the stake in IndiGo's parent company was sold in a block deal during Thursday's trading session.

Why Resourceful Automobile IPO disappointed investors after huge IPO bidsInvestors poured money into the SME IPO, as it got bids close to Rs 5,000 crore, which is huge for a firm that operates with just 8 employees and 2 outlets.

Gautam Adani tops 2024 Hurun India Rich List 2024, surpasses Mukesh AmbaniHurun India Rich List 2024: Gautam Adani, 62, and his family have dethroned Ambani, who now holds the second position with a fortune of Rs 10.14 lakh crore.

Reliance-Disney merger cleared, but what were the key concerns? The approval came with significant scrutiny, especially regarding the dominance of the two companies in sports broadcasting and advertising.

Reliance AGM: 5 top expectations to watch out for, where to watchThe Reliance AGM will begin at 2:00 PM and Mukesh Ambani, the Chairman of RIL, will address shareholders and provide updates on several important aspects of the company's operations.

Reliance AGM 2024: RIL on track to double in size by decade's end, says Mukesh AmbaniAt the Reliance AGM 2024, Mukesh Ambani highlighted several key developments. Jio has become the world's largest mobile data company, managing nearly 8% of global traffic and solidifying India's position as the top data market. Ambani announced the Jio AI-Cloud Welcome offer, launching this Diwali, which will provide up to 100 GB of free cloud storage and competitive pricing for additional storage, reflecting Jio's "AI Everywhere For Everyone" vision. Reliance's FY24 R&D investment exceeded Rs 3,643 crore (US$ 437 million), underscoring its commitment to innovation. The new Jio Brain suite aims to enhance AI adoption across Jio and other Reliance businesses. Additionally, Ambani revealed plans for the Dhirubhai Ambani Green Energy Giga Manufacturing Complex in Jamnagar, set to be the world's largest and most advanced solar production facility, driving the company's New Energy ambitions.

Resourceful Automobile shares list flat at issue price despite huge bidding Resourceful Automobile listing: The stock, which attracted bids worth Rs 4,800 crore for its Rs 12 crore IPO, was listed at its exact IPO price of Rs 117 per share.
Berkshire Hathaway becomes first non-tech US firm to hit $1 trillion market capThe company's stocks have climbed 30% in 2024, outperforming the S&P 500's gain of 18% so far.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Maharashtra structural consultant arrested in Shivaji statue collapse caseStructural consultant Chetan Patil was arrested from Kolhapur in connection with the collapse of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj's statue in Maharashtra's Sindhudurg district.

BJP 'forcing' Chief Secretary to quit, appoint Shinde aide: Aaditya ThackerayShiv Sena (UBT) leader Aaditya Thackeray chided the Maharashtra government over reports claiming Sujata Saunik, the state's first woman Chief Secretary, being forced to resign and make way for former BMC chief Iqbal Singh Chahal with Chief Minister Eknath Shinde's backing.

Man, 24, dies after SUV driven by 17-year-old hits his bike in MumbaiAn SUV driven allegedly by a 17-year-old boy hit a 24-year-old biker in Mumbai, killing him. The teen was arrested when he tried to escape after his SUV crashed into an electric pole.

'Barry Stanton' X account suspended over racist posts on IndiansThe action came after Barry Stanton's posts were flagged by hundreds of irate Indians, with several calling out Elon Musk for not suspending the account.

Tiny kitchen, mini cutlery, 42 million views: Why do miniature videos go viral?A viral video on Instagram, of someone cooking chicken biryani, has an unbelievable 42 million views. The twist? Everything is tiny.

Same old, tired playbook: Kamala Harris claps back after Trump's racial attackDemocratic nominee for the US Presidential election and Vice President Kamala Harris sat for her first interview on Thursday since launching her campaign.

Gujarat braces for Cyclone Asna, heavy rain batters Saurashtra-Kachchh regionThe deep depression over Saurashtra and Kutch has started moving slowly westwards at a speed of around three kilometres per hour during the past six hours and is expected to hit the coast on Friday.

Want more babies: Trump says would fund IVF, then 'backs' abortion rightsUS Election: Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump said, if elected, he would make the government or insurance companies cover the costs of in vitro fertilisation, and also criticised Florida's six-week abortion ban.

Amitabh Bachchan, 4th richest in Bollywood, once earned Rs 400 a monthActor Amitabh Bachchan, who was named as the fourth richest Bollywood celebrity in the 2024 Hurun India Rich List, recently shared that he once lived in a room with eight people and earned Rs 400 a month.

LGBTQ persons can now open joint bank accounts, Centre says 'no restrictions'The Finance Ministry has clarified that there are no restrictions on LGBTQ+ individuals opening joint bank accounts or nominating their partners as beneficiaries.

Action against cop after actor Darshan seen entering Ballari jail with 'sunglasses'Kannada actor Darshan Thogudeepa, accused in a murder case, faced a new controversy after he was seen entering the Ballari jail with 'sunglasses' hanging on his branded T-shirt. A police officer was facing disciplinary action over the incident.

Rights body's notice to Kolkata cops over 'barbaric' action on Nabanna protestersCalling the use of force on protesting students during the 'Nabanna Abhijan' protest as "barbaric" and "brutal", the National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) has sought a report from Kolkata Police in connection matter.

Angelina Jolie in tears as her film 'Maria' gets 8-minute standing ovationActor Angelina Jolie was visibly moved after her film 'Maria' received an eight-minute standing ovation at the Venice Film Festival. The film is a biographical drama about the Greek opera singer Maria Callas.

First man with Neuralink implant says he is using it to learn French, finish his degreeNoland Arbaugh, the first person to receive a Neuralink implant, is actively using it for educational and creative pursuits.

Navi Mumbai property dealer's contract to kill friend backfires in stunning twistA property dealer from Navi Mumbai hired a contract killer to kill his friend over a dispute regarding a land deal. While his friend was killed, he too was murdered after the killers demanded the full amount from him while suspecting foul play.

My grammar's not always correct: Tim Walz admits he misspoke about being in warKamala Harris's running mate for the US presidential election, Tim Walz, admitted he misspoke about carrying assault weapons in war, also emphasising that he is proud of his army career.

To BJP and back in 4 days, AAP leader says 'Arvind Kejriwal came in my dream'Ram Chander, a former MLA from Bawana Assembly and currently a sitting councillor, expressed regret over his brief stint with the BJP. He said his decision to return to AAP was influenced by a dream he had.
Minor raped in Ghaziabad, angry mob vandalises shops, sets vehicles ablazeA scrap dealer broke into the minor's home and then assaulted her along with his accomplices.

Israel, Hamas agree to 3-day pause in fighting for Gaza polio vaccinations: WHOIsrael and Hamas have agreed to a three-day pause in fighting in Gaza to allow the first round of polio vaccination of 640,000 children in the war-torn Palestinian enclave. The vaccinations will begin from Sunday.

Remembering Dhyan Chand, the hockey legend who refused to salute HitlerMajor Dhyan Chand captained the Indian hockey team to three Olympic gold medals, an extraordinary achievement that remains unparalleled in the sport. On his birth anniversary, know about his alleged interaction with Adolf Hitler.

Afghanistan's Rashid Khan takes break from Test cricket to manage injury issuesAfghanistan's star spinner Rashid Khan will take a lengthy break from Test cricket to maintain his workload. Rashid has been dealing with back injury concerns after having had surgery last year.

Devine to resign as White Ferns T20I skipper after T20 World CupVeteran all-rounder Sophie Devine said that she will step down as the New Zealand in T20Is after the World Cup, but will continue leading the White Ferns in ODIs.

US Open: Elena Rybakina withdraws from US Open due to injuryElena Rybakina's US Open run ended in disappointment as the world number four withdrew due to injury before her second-round match, dashing her hopes of finally making a deep run at the only Grand Slam she hasn't mastered yet.

In love with New York, Jannik Sinner eases into Round 3 after 'special 50'US Open 2024: Jannik Sinner became the first man to complete 50 wins on the tour in men's singles in 2024. He achieved the milestone when he hammered USA's Alex Michelsen 6-4, 6-0, 6-2 in the second round on Thursday, August 29.

Champions League set for new era: Madrid vs Liverpool, Barcelona vs BayernAs the UEFA Champions League steps into a new era under its brand-new format, the league phase draw on August 29 has revealed who the top European sides will go up against in the competition. Real Madrid against Liverpool, Barcelona against Bayern Munich are some of the headline clashes.

India at Paralympics, Day 2 Full Schedule: Medal events begin in para-athletics Paralympics 2024 India Schedule Day 2 (August 30): Team India will look to open its medal tally at the 2024 Paris Paralympic Games on Friday, with Avani Lekhara and Manish Narwal set to kick off their campaigns.

Jasmine Paolini continues dream run in 2024, Anna Kalinskaya advancesUS Open 2024: Jasmine Paolini continued her dream run this year, progressing to the third round of the US Open for the first time in her career. She spent less than 10 minutes on the court on Thursday as her opponent -- former World No. 1 Karolina Pliskova, retired in the first game after an ankle injury.

US Open tennis players take naps before matches, especially late onesUS Open 2024: Tennis players are increasingly valuing naps to enhance their performance, especially before night matches. Deandra Dottin back in West Indies squad for T20 World CupDeandra Dottin has been picked in the West Indies squad for the next T20 World Cup, just a month after reconsidering her international retirement. Dottin, who scored the fastest century in women's T20Is, unexpectedly quit international cricket in 2022, claiming issues with the team climate.

Manchester United's Mason Mount ruled out with muscle injuryMason Mount has expressed "frustration" after being ruled out with a muscle injury, the latest blow in his injury-plagued Manchester United career. The offensive midfielder suffered an injury during the first half of Saturday's 2-1 loss against Brighton and was replaced at halftime.

Afghanistan's Rashid Khan takes break from Test cricket to manage injury issuesAfghanistan's star spinner Rashid Khan will take a lengthy break from Test cricket to maintain his workload. Rashid has been dealing with back injury concerns after having had surgery last year.

Cristiano Ronaldo, Champions League's all-time scorer, honoured by UEFACristiano Ronaldo, the all-time leading goalscorer in the UEFA Champions League, was honoured with a special award by UEFA President Aleksander Ceferin. The award recognises Ronaldo's remarkable achievements and enduring legacy in European club football.

Lukaku continues Italy tour, signs for Napoli from Chelsea on 3-year dealNapoli have completed the signing Romelu Lukaku from Chelsea on a 3-year-contract, which further extends his Italian journey across three of the top Serie A clubs - Inter Milan, AS Roma, and now the Gil Azzuri.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
